name: 2 by 2 Formation
effect: Permanent. Discard at any time, or when a new formation is played. For each four marines at the same location during the ready round, gain one Combat Pool.
OK, Frost, Dietrich, you're up!

name: A Bad Feeling
effect: Unique. Permanent. Play on a human. Minus 1 defense. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
When we get back without ya, I'll call your folks.

name: A Kill with No Honor
effect: If a Predator just killed, and if the killed character's best damage was less than the Predator's resistance plus armor, the kill provides no honor.
Without risk, there is no honor.

name: Access Space
effect: The first person to play this card picks one additional location. That location is adjacent to the Access Space. This effect is permanent.
I think she went into the air ducts.

name: Access Tunnel
effect: One or more characters moving together may move through two additional locations when moving this turn. These characters move with no penalty past all opponents.
Crawling beats walking through a room full of Aliens.

name: Acid Resistant Claws
effect: Does Power +3 damage. Cannot be destroyed by Acid.
Made from an alkaline metallic alloy.

name: Acid Splash
effect: Play when an attacking Alien is killed. The Alien's target suffers 6 damage, and one random item is destroyed by Acid (discard it).
... with concentrated acid for blood ...

name: Acid Spray
effect: Play at the end of combat. Each non-Alien at a location with a just killed Alien takes 1 point of Environmental Acid Damage.
Even dead they are dangerous.

name: Activate Self Destruct
effect: Predator must have a Speed of 0 to play this card. Active the Self Destruct item.
It is more honorable to die than to live with defeat.

name: Adapt and Overcome
effect: Play after you roll the die in combat. The next time you need a die roll, use this roll instead. Costs 3 Combat Pool.
The enemy can be your best teacher.

name: Adrenaline Rush
effect: Plus 1 to hit. May not be used by a character who is a Coward.
You don't get a rush like this from flipping burgers.

name: Advantageous Terrain
effect: Plus 1 to hit. In addition, +1 to hit if defender's location is Confined with no Cover.
We make our stand here!

name: Aggravated Wound
effect: Play on a character who just took damage but survived. Character's player loses 2 Combat Pool.
An injured warrior can be more of a drain on your foe than a dead one.

name: Air Control Fans
effect: Permanent. Prevent all Evironmental Gas Damage at this location.
They make the air breathable.

name: Airlock
effect: For ships too large to use the docking bay.

name: Alien Birth
effect: The Alien player immediately captures one Supporting Character. Costs 3 Combat Pool (1 Combat Pool if character is uncontrolled.)
Some victims don't even realize they've been impregnated until too late.

name: Alien Hunter
effect: One Alien character begins using hidden movement with three markers. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Maybe they don't show up on infrared.

name: Alien Pursuit
effect: At the end of the Movement round, one Alien (which can move) moves 1 location if that puts it in the same location as an opponent.
They move even faster when they are running down prey.

name: Alien Queen
effect: Can never move. Alien Queen does Power +3 damage. (See special Alien rules.)
Something must be laying those eggs.

name: Alien Stealth
effect: All Aliens currently at Hive locations begin using Hidden Movement with 1 marker each.
They can blend right into the walls of their hive.

name: Alien Warrior
effect: Alien Warrior does Power +3 damage.
They grow into killers in a matter of days.

name: Alien Wave
effect: After initial Alien declares an attack, each additional Alien gains a cumulative +1 to hit the same target.
They're coming out of the ... walls!

name: Ambush
effect: A hidden character who declares an attack against an opponent who did not declare an attack gains +3 to hit.
Hit hard and with surprise.

name: Ambush Point
effect: Aliens at this location may resolve Close Combat attacks simultaneously with all Ranged attacks.
There could be anything hiding in there ...

name: Armory
effect: Unique. Rotate at this location to search your deck and find the first Equipment, Weaponry, or Military Arms card. Shuffle your deck.
I feel much safer in here.

name: Ash
effect: Generates 1 research point per turn without rotating. Cannot attack Aliens.
You still don't understand what you're dealing with, do you?

name: At Any Price
effect: Character can ignore all damage for 3 turns, unless the damage kills. Costs 2 Combat Pool per point of damage ignored.
... Victory!

name: At the Limit
effect: Opposing player's Combat Pool is limited to its current level. Lasts 3 turns. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
You can only push so hard.

name: Atmosphere Processor
effect: ... we manufacture these, by the way.

name: Baptism of Fire
effect: Permanent. Marine character who declares an attack gains the Veteran or Brave resource, or he loses the Coward resource.
Real combat will sort you out real fast. We'll soon know what you're made of.

name: Barracks
effect: Not exactly five-star hotel accommodations.

name: Battle Standard
effect: Plus 1 to hit for any of your Marines at its location. If it is dropped, all Marines suffer -1 to hit until it is recovered.
We don't take our hats off for anything else except prayers.

name: Battlefield Chaos
effect: Character must pay 2 Combat Pool to rotate this turn.
What's happening, Apone? I can't see anything in here.

name: Berserk
effect: Permanent. Combat Pool costs are halved (rounded down) for this character, but each combat pool costs 1 damage point.
Rage is powerful, but it can also burn you up.

name: Bishop
effect: Rotate to generate 1 research point.
I may be synthetic, but I'm not stupid.

name: Black Marketeer
effect: Unique. Rotate this character and pay 3 Combat Pool to find any card from your deck. Add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
Hey, a guy's got to make a living.

name: Blaze the Path
effect: At the start of combat, roll a die. On a 5 or 6, gain one free attack with the Flame Thrower at each hidden marker at this location.
With this baby, you don't need a candle to light your way!

name: Block
effect: If a character is at a location with one of your characters, its movement is reduced by 1 (2 if your character has tactics).
Oh no you don't!

name: Body Slam
effect: Plus 2 Close Combat damage. In addition, +2 Close Combat damage if the location is Confined.
Don't get caught between a Predator and a hard place.

name: Booby Trap
effect: At the start of combat, play on a location where your Marine ended his last turn while ready. Attack each character at that location for 8 points of damage.
If your movements are predictable, so is your fate.

name: Bottled Courage
effect: Character who possesses this item removes Coward or adds Brave resource. Minus 1 to hit.
Buy the next round and I'll tell you about the bugs we 'capped' last time out.

name: Breakthrough
effect: Provides 2 research points.
We've been studying this phenomenon.

name: Breeding Chamber
effect: Aliens may move to or from this and any other Hive location for 2 moves.
The center of the hive is here with the Queen and her eggs.
attributes: • Restrictions: Only Hive locations may be adjacent.

name: Bug Hunt
effect: Reduce the movement of all your Marines by 1 this turn, but roll a die for each hidden marker that is at or enters their location(s). On a 5 or 6, reveal it.
A xenomorph may be involved.

name: Burst Pipe
effect: Play when a Ranged attack of 10 or more damage misses. Causes 1 point of Environmental Damage to every character (and hidden marker) at defender's location.
The steam in those pipes can be hot, toxic, or both.

name: Calculated Risk
effect: Any two or more characters with Tactics use one die roll to resolve their attacks.
Sometimes big risks yield big rewards ... sometimes.

name: Camouflage
effect: The owner may use hidden movement with two markers.
To a seasoned sniper, these are just work clothes.

name: Camouflage Suit
effect: Plus 1 defense. Whenever he is allowed to move, the owner may use hidden movement with 3 markers.

His greatest asset is surprise.

Promo card, the title is printed in a larger font than the font used during the production run.

name: Camouflage Suit
effect: Plus 1 defense. Whenever he is allowed to move, the owner may use hidden movement with 3 markers.
His greatest asset is surprise.

name: Captured
effect: Play to capture a character you just killed in Close Combat.
They're still alive!

name: Cargo Bay
effect: It's where we keep our stuff.

name: Carpe Corpus
effect: Make one free attack at -1 to hit against a Supporting Character during the Search round, if the Supporting Character has just been discovered.
Seize the body.

name: Carter Burke
effect: When searching Weaponry locations, he can also find Equipment or Military Arms.
This installation has a substantial dollar value attached to it.

name: Ceiling Highway
effect: Character begins using hidden movement with 2 markers.
They can move as easily through the ceiling as upon the ground.

name: Ceremonial Armor
effect: Provides 1 armor.
It's more for display than protection.

name: Chemical Base
effect: Discard to cancel Acid Damage on a character at the same location.
High school chemistry does have a payoff.

name: Chest Burster
effect:
It gestates inside a human host.

Promo card, the title is printed in a larger font than the font used during the production run.

name: Chest Burster
effect: It gestates inside a human host.

name: Child
effect: She snuck into the kitchen for a bite to eat.

name: Close Quarters
effect: An Alien who attacked a human last turn but failed to kill may not be attacked by any human besides its target if it attacks the same target.
Its breath alone may be deadly.

name: CN-20 Nerve Gas
effect: Rotate Marine character and drop item to activate. At the end of the next turn, all characters within 2 locations take 6 points of Environmental Gas Damage.
I say we nerve gas the entire nest!

name: Cocooned Victim
effect: This character is automatically considered to be captured by the Alien player when found.
Kill me, please ...

name: Collapsible Spear
effect: Does Power +4 damage. Can be used in Close Combat or as a Short-Ranged weapon. Is dropped at location after any Ranged attack.
It provides formidable utility.

name: Combat Knife
effect: Does Power +2 damage.
A gun just plain works better.

name: Combat Mastery
effect: Spend three (or six) Combat Pool to add one (or two) to a character's Speed, Power, and rolls to hit. Lasts one turn.
Beyond training there is experience, beyond experience there is mastery.

name: Committed Posture
effect: Opposing player loses 1 Combat Pool each turn during his Ready Round. Lasts 5 turns. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
We can't back out now.

name: Communications Array
effect: Owner adds Communications resource.
Command and control is almost entirely dependent upon communications.

name: Communications Center
effect: It's our only contact with the outside world.

name: Company Official
effect: Unique. Plus 2 defense.
She's great at looking out for number 1.

name: Computer Center
effect:
The station is highly automated.

Promo card, the title is printed in a larger font than the font used during the production run.

name: Computer Center
effect: The station is highly automated.

name: Concentrated Fire
effect: Plus 2 damage. Does an additional +1 damage if used with a Smart Gun.
Hit one target hard, and take him out.

name: Conestoga Class
effect: Humans at this location rotate to heal 2 points of damage. At this location, rotate to find any human Item card in the player's deck for 1 Combat Pool.
The Sulaco was an all-purpose Marine transport also tasked for light assault.
attributes: • Restrictions: Only Entry locations may be adjacent.

name: Corporate Agent
effect: Unique
My company has more operatives than the CIA.

name: Corporate Office
effect: This facility is under corporate administration. Try not to forget it.

name: Corridor
effect: Looks like hits from small arms fire.

name: Counter
effect: Cancel an event with an ongoing effect which required Combat Pool. Costs 1 Combat Pool more than the event countered.
The move was easy enough to foresee.

name: Cover Formation
effect: Permanent. Discard at any time, or when a new formation is played. Each Marine may guard one Supporting Character at the same location, who may not be attacked. Each Marine is -1 defense.
C'mon people, let's keep these civies alive, it's what they pay us for!

name: Covering Fire
effect: Character gains +1 defense for each character targeting his attacker.
Keep me covered!

name: Cower
effect: Rotate a character to double his defense. Character does not Ready on the next Ready round.
He who fights and runs away...

name: Cpl Ackels
effect:
He says flying is an art. Right.

Promo card, the title is printed in a larger font than the font used during the production run.

name: Cpl Ackels
effect: He says flying is an art. Right.

name: Cpl Brown
effect: Plus 1 to hit. If he rolls a 1 in combat, his weapon is Damaged.
22 confirmed kills... most were hostile.

name: Cpl Hicks
effect: Plus 1 to hit with Ranged weapons. Rotate to Ready any Marine at the same location.
All right people, let's move like we've got a purpose.

name: Cpl Myler
effect: Plus 1 to hit with the M42-A Scope Rifle.
You can count on him to get the job done.

name: Crazed Civilian
effect: Permanent. Play immediately after a Supporting Character has been found. He will remain uncontrolled, and makes a free attack at every character who enters his location.
Sometimes they just break down from the stress.

name: Critical Hit
effect: Play on a character who has just been Damaged in combat. Remove one resource until it heals completely.
That one had to hurt.

name: Crossfire
effect: Play on 2 or more characters at the same location who are making a Ranged attack. Each gains +1 to hit (+2 if the character possesses Tactics).
Catch 'em right here. This will be our killing zone.

name: Crude Explosives
effect: Rotate owner to make a Long-Ranged attack on every character at a location. Attacks are at -1 to hit. Does 8 damage. Discard.
Probably seismic survey charges.

name: Cryonics Chamber
effect: Rip Van Winkle would have loved this place.

name: Cunning Hunter
effect: 9 honor.
A powerful opponent under all conditions.

name: Dallas
effect: May use Military Arms.
Will you just listen to me?

name: Darts
effect: Does 6 damage.
Not very powerful. They make the hunt more challenging.

name: Dead End
effect: Force an opponent to rotate a card immediately, with no effect. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
Oops.

name: Death from Above
effect: Hidden Alien gains +2 to hit. His attack is resolved before Ranged attacks.
I'm telling you, man, they're right on top of us!

name: Defend the Hive
effect: For duration of turn, all Aliens starting at Hive locations gain +1 Speed. May only be played once per turn.
Ever kick over an anthill?

name: Demolition Charge
effect: At the end of combat, Marine with this item rotates to drop. At the start of the next Combat round, all characters at this location suffer 13 points of damage and the location becomes Damaged. Discard item.
The latest thing in urban renewal.

name: Desperate Leap
effect: Roll a die. Add roll -2 to defense.
I can make it!

name: Desperate Shot
effect: If Marine misses a character who is attacking him in Close Combat, he gains a free attack at -1 to hit.
Keep firing!

name: Deteriorating Situation
effect: All players lose 1 Combat Pool during the Ready round. Lasts for 5 turns.
Well that's great... now what are we supposed to do?

name: Dire Straits
effect: Opponent must pay double for each Combat Pool expenditure this turn.
It can't get any worse.

name: Disarmament
effect: Attack a character's item. It has the same defense as its owner. If the item is hit, it is destroyed (discard it).
We've got to get tougher armor.

name: Disengaging Attack
effect: Play on one or more of your characters at the same location who have declared attacks. They are -2 to hit and damage, but may move 1 location immediately after combat.
Lay down suppressing fire and cover our retreat.

name: Dishonor
effect: Permanent. Play on any Predator location. Any character rotating at this location while the Predator is absent costs the Predator 1 honor.
If you cannot protect your own base, you are weak.

name: Display of Skill
effect: Pay 10 Combat Pool to reduce your honor requirement for victory by 5.
There is more to being a great hunter than just the kill.

name: Dissection
effect: Permanent. Play this card after killing a Predator or Alien. Generate 5 research points to gain +1 to hit all characters of that species for the rest of the game.
Its structural perfection is matched only by its hostility.

name: Docking Bay
effect: The resupply point for the station.

name: Dockworker
effect: Does Power +2 damage in close combat.
Space bug or not, don't mess with the Union.

name: Dodge
effect: Plus 1 defense. In addition, +1 defense if character's location has Cover.
There's quick and then there's dead.

name: Dodge and Roll
effect: Rotate a character you control to gain +4 defense (+6 if Veteran).
Kiss the deck, then come up shooting.

name: Double-Packed Ammo
effect: Character with this item adds +1 to his Small Arms or Shotgun's damage. If weapon becomes damaged, it is destroyed instead (discard both cards).
More bang for your buck, but it goes both ways.

name: Dwindling Options
effect: For every 1 Combat Pool you pay, your opponent must discard one random card. (He waits to the next Draw round to refill his hand.)
A foe without options is as good as defeated.

name: Eager Youth
effect: 3 honor. Cannot Ready during the next Ready round whenever he rolls a 1 in combat.
He does not yet have wisdom or experience.

name: Eat This
effect: Plus 2 to hit and damage against an Alien, but attacker takes 3 points of Acid Damage. Resistance does not reduce the damage. Any armor that is not acid resistant is destroyed (discard it).
Close encounters of the deadly kind.

name: Eat Vacuum
effect: Play on an Entry location where you have a character. Everyone at that location is killed at the end of the next round, unless they have Environmental Damage prevention.
In space, no one can hear you scream.

name: Egg Sack Detachment
effect: Replace the Alien Queen with the Warrior Queen card from your play hand. Discard the Alien Queen.
When necessary for survival, a Queen can detach herself from the egg sack.

name: Electronics Tech
effect: Minus 1 to hit. Rotate at any location to remove a Power Outage for one turn, or at the Power Plant to remove one completely.
Sure I can get it working... just as soon as you get me the parts from Earth.

name: Elevator
effect: This location is distinct. It is not the same location as any other Elevator. A character may move between Elevator locations in 1 move.
The fastest access to all levels of the complex.

name: Emergency Escape Vessel
effect: Evacuate one or more characters from one location. (They leave the game.)
I say... we get the shuttle and get the... out of here!

name: Empty
effect: Play on a character during the Combat round. The character runs out of ammo at the end of the combat round. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
Click, click, click...

name: End of the Line
effect: Cancel and discard a Permanent Event card. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
It's just not gonna happen.

name: Engineer
effect: Minus 1 to hit.
What do you want me to do, part the sea?

name: Engineering
effect: This is really the heart of the station.

name: Equipment Warehouse
effect: Rotate at this location to search your deck and find the first Equipment card. Shuffle your deck.
You never know what you may find.

name: Evacuation
effect: Location gains the Secure, Civilian, or Hi-Tech resource for the rest of the turn.
Get those people out of here!

name: Experimental Rifle
effect: Unique. Roll a die when fired: 1: Destroyed, user takes 6 damage. 2: No effect. 3: +2 to hit and 8 damage. 4 or 5: +2 to hit and 10 damage. 6: +3 to hit and 13 damage.
So what happens when I activate this red switch?

name: Extra Ammo
effect: Rotate to reload a weapon you carry (the weapon is no longer out of ammo).
A pulse rifle without ammo's 'bout as good as a paperweight.

name: Extremely Agitated
effect: All Aliens at this location must attack valid targets of your choice this Combat round. Costs 3 Combat Pool.
Instinct sometimes works against them.

name: Face Hugger Attack
effect: This card attacks one opponent at or moving through a Hive location any time during the Movement round. The attack is at -2 to hit. If hit, the target is captured by the Alien player.
They killed him taking it off.

name: Facing Bad Luck
effect: Character must roll again. Costs 2 Combat Pool, or no cost if opponent's character is Unlucky, or your character is Lucky.
Trouble is just waiting to hatch.

name: Fast Claw
effect: 12 honor. Plus 1 to hit in Close Combat.
How can anything that big move so fast?

name: Field Pack
effect: Contains M41A Pulse Rifle (Long-Ranged, 10 damage) and M3 Body Armor (provides 2 armor).
USCM standard issue arms and armor for combat patrols.

name: Field Promotion
effect: If you control no Marines who are Leaders, the highest ranking Marine you control becomes a Leader. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
I believe Corporal Hicks is in charge.

name: Fiery Defense
effect: Rotate and roll a die. Add the roll to the character's defense. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Sometimes risks pay off.

name: Fire Alarm
effect: Rotate any non-Alien character at the beginning of movement to reveal any hidden Predator markers at or moving through this location. The Camouflage Suit is damaged for the rest of the turn.
Predator technology is liable to short-circuit when wet.

name: Flanking
effect: Plus 1 to hit. In addition, +1 to hit if character is at the same location as his target and his target is being attacked by another character.
I'll keep him occupied, you work your way around him.

name: Flesh Wound
effect: Plus 1 resistance.
It missed all his vital organs.

name: Fog of War
effect: Your opponent loses 1 Combat Pool.
There is always confusion in the heat of battle.

name: Fortify
effect: Permanent. Place this card under a location. All of your characters gain +1 defense while at this location.
We'll hole up here.

name: Found 'Em
effect: Play at the start of movement. All players find the top location in their decks, and play them immediately. Shuffle the decks.
These are the maps to most of the facility.

name: Frenzy
effect: Gain a free attack for each 2 Alien tokens on this Character card. All attacks are made with no bonuses to hit or damage, including bonuses from Alien tokens.
Worse than sharks in bloody water.

name: Friendly Fire
effect: If a character just made a Ranged attack and missed, he attacks a friendly character within range of your choice.
I said CEASE FIRE!

name: From Behind
effect: Gain plus 1 damage in Close Combat. In addition, gain +1 damage if the character is Lethal, +1 damage if Alien, and +1 damage if a Queen.
At close quarters they are exceedingly lethal.

name: Garrison Pack
effect: Contains Small Arms (Short-Ranged, 7 damage) and Flack Jacket (provides 1 armor).
USCM standard issue arms and armor for garrison duty.

name: Get Away from Her
effect: Character must change the target of his attack to a valid target you control. He gains +1 to hit. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Over here!

name: Ghost Image
effect: A hidden character adds one additional hidden movement marker this turn.
I'm gettin' a weird signal.

name: Good Shot
effect: Plus 1 to hit. In addition, +1 to hit if Marksman or Veteran.
Check your target, exhale, and squeeze...

name: Got It
effect: Name a card. Search your deck until you find the named card. Discard all other cards seen. (If the searching character is a Scout, shuffle your deck instead.)
I knew this baby would come in handy someday.

name: Grapple
effect: A hit in Close Combat does half damage, but reduces the target's Speed by 2 until the end of the next turn.
They pull you down, then take you out.

name: Gray Stripe
effect: 7 honor.
Strong, but fate does not favor him.

name: Grenade Launcher
effect: Character with this item attacks all characters at a location for 8 damage.
With a 10 meter explosive pattern, use within enclosed spaces is not advised.

name: Hacker
effect: Unique. Minus 1 to hit.
Listen, cowboy, the only password I need is the name of your bank.

name: Hand Welder
effect: Rotate owner to drop this item between any two locations. If owner remains at his location and rotates again at the end of the next turn, the locations are no longer adjacent.
With this baby, you can put up a barrier that nothing can get through.

name: Hardpoint
effect: A Marine at this location may rotate it. The location makes a Long-Ranged attack for 8 damage.
The defenses here include particle beam phalanx weapons.

name: Have Me Some Fun
effect: Use Combat Pool to make a hit cause damage (ignoring armor and resistance) of: 1 Combat Pool -- 1 damage; 3 Combat Pool -- 2 damage; 6 Combat Pool -- 3 damage; or 10 Combat Pool -- 4 damage.
You're not gonna walk away from this one!

name: Head Shot
effect: Play before die roll. If roll to hit exceeds the defense by 1, rotate defender; by 3, plus 2 damage and rotate for 2 turns; by 5, defender is killed. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
It's the surest way to take out ANYTHING.

name: Heat Exchanger
effect: If this location is Damaged, it will explode in 3 turns, destroying itself, all connected locations, and their contents. Discard all cards.
If you rupture the cooling tower... Adios Muchachos!

name: Heat of Battle
effect: Unique. All players gain 1 Combat Pool at the beginning of each Combat round. Lasts 5 turns.
Get hot, people!

name: Heroic Stand
effect: Plus 2 to hit and plus 2 damage. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Must have been one helluva fight.

name: Hidden
effect: Permanent. Play on a location. From now on, a character must rotate for two turns (or two characters must search) to find an item at this location.
Did you try looking under the floor plates?

name: Hidey Hole
effect: Permanent. Play on a location. From now on, a character must rotate for two turns (or two characters must search) to find a supporting character at this location.
This little girl survived... with no weapons and no training.

name: Hive Construction
effect: Rotate 2 Aliens to Hive this location.
It's made from some sort of secreted resin.

name: Hived Airlock
effect: You can go in...but you may not come out.

name: Hived Corridor
effect: This location is distinct. It is not the same location as any other Hived Corridor.
Just another passage to oblivion.

name: Hived Cryonics
effect: Pray that you never wake up.

name: Hived Engineering
effect: The Aliens have little apparent use for the artifice of mankind.

name: Hived Hall
effect: I believe the Queen has the floor...

name: Hived Lounge
effect: Guess they didn't like karaoke.

name: Hived Main Corridor
effect: Don't nobody touch nothin'!

name: Hived Passage
effect: From the way this place looks, there must have been a firefight.

name: Hived Plant
effect: How can they cut the power?

name: Hived Processor
effect: Looks like someone decided to redecorate.

name: Hived Quarters
effect: The former occupant left no forwarding address.

name: Hived Shop
effect: Rotate this location and a character at this location to repair a Damaged item in his possession.
We need those parts! Let's go, before someone comes visiting!

name: Hived Storage
effect: I wonder what THEY store here.

name: Honored Elder
effect: 8 honor. Hand size is -1 card. Whenever he gains Combat Pool, including starting CP gain double the stated amount
A bit slower. A lot smarter.

name: Hull Breach
effect: Permenant. Causes 4 points of Environmental Damage to anyone at or moving through this location.
It's a catastrophic structural failure.

name: Hunter's Mask
effect: View any hidden markers at your location (except Aliens at Hive locations). Provides immunity to Environmental Gas Damage.
It allows a Predator to see in several spectra.

name: Hunting Kit
effect: Contains Melee Claws (Does Power +3 damage), Mask (take no damage from Environmental Gas), and Ceremonial Armor (Provides 1 armor).
The standard equipment chosen for most hunts.

name: Huntmaster
effect: 13 Honor. He may rotate to prevent any other character at his location from attacking.
He enforces the rules of the hunt.

name: I Can Take It
effect: Plus 1 resistance. In addition, +1 resistance if Marine and +1 resistance if Veteran.
It'll take a lot more than that to hurt a Marine!

name: I Can't Lock In
effect: Motion Scanner is damaged for 2 turns.
You're not reading it right!

name: I Work Best Alone
effect: Character must be the only human at this location. He may add or subtract one (or two if veteran) from all die rolls involving him this turn. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
You'll just slow me down.

name: If It Bleeds
effect: Plus 1 damage. In addition, +1 damage if Marine and +1 damage if Veteran.
... we can kill it.

name: Infirmary
effect: Rotate a human character at this location to heal 2 points of damage.

... and you get breakfast in bed.

This version of Infirmary came with the Marines Starter Deck.

name: Infirmary
effect: Rotate a human character at this location to heal 2 points of damage.

... and you get breakfast in bed.

This version of Infirmary came with the Predator Starter Deck.

name: Infrared Binoculars
effect: Owner views all hidden markers at his location, except hidden Aliens at Hive locations.
High ambient temperatures impair their effectiveness.

name: Instinctive Escape
effect: Plus 1 defense. In addition, +1 defense if the location has Cover, and +1 defense if Alien at a Hive location.
They don't need any training to move like that.

name: Isolated Corridor
effect: This location is distinct. It is not the same location as any other Isolated Corridor.
Where are we now? I dunno. But it's quiet. Too quiet.

name: It Was a Bad Call
effect: Character is Unlucky for 3 turns.
Bad decisions can cost lives, sometimes your own.

name: It's Just the Cat
effect: Play when a hidden character's marker would be revealed by another player's actions. It remains hidden. Any attacks on it do not hit.
Jonesey!

name: Juggernaut
effect: Roll a die, pay that much Combat Pool, then add or subtract one from any other die roll. You may repeat as long as you can pay every required Combat Pool cost.
Don't let up on the pressure!

name: Kane
effect: Rotate to search your deck for the next location card, which is played adjacent to his location. Move Kane to the new location. Shuffle your deck.
I'll volunteer to be in the first group out.

name: Kill and Kill Again
effect: Gain a free attack if your roll to hit was at least 3 higher than the target's defenses.
Easy pickings.

name: Kitchen
effect: The food here may not be gourmet, but it sure beats K rations.

name: Know Your Enemy
effect: Permanent. Your hand size increases by 1 for reaching an opponent's starting location. May only play once for each opponent.
We've been learning its habits.

name: Lab Worker
effect: Minus 1 to hit. Rotate for 1 research point.
Please don't touch that. We think it may be toxic.

name: Lambert
effect: May double movement points by reducing defense to 0 until the end of the turn.
I say that we abandon ship...

name: Landing Pad
effect: I want an immediate dust-off on my clear.

name: Laser Sight
effect: Plus 1 to hit with Ranged weapons. A hidden owner must declare his attacks at the same time as unhidden characters.
It 'paints' the target for greater long-range accuracy.

name: Lay of the Land
effect: Unique. Permanent. Rotate and play after moving through 5 different locations. Gain 1 Combat Pool at the beginning of each movement round.
A good hunter knows his hunting ground.

name: Learning Experience
effect: Unique. Gain 1 Combat Pool for each target your characters attacked but did not hit this turn.
You'll know what NOT to do next time.

name: Let's Rock
effect: Plus 1 to hit for all Marines with Ranged attacks at a single location. In addition, each Marine at the location firing a Smart Gun gains +1 to hit.
Call it personal initiative.

name: Like a Ghost
effect: Character moving past opponents this turn gains 1 extra move (3 if hidden or a Scout).
For something so BIG, it sure moves quietly.

name: Limb from Limb
effect: Increase Close Combat damage by 1 per 1 Combat Pool spent. Maximum is twice the damage target would have taken after resistance reduction.
Ain't no way for no soldier to die!

name: Living Quarters
effect: It may be small, but it's home.

name: Long Range Shot
effect: Character attacks one location beyond his range with a Ranged weapon, but at -2 to hit.
It's beyond the theoretical range of the gun.

name: Look Sharp
effect: Cancel any Event card that adds to or subtracts from a die roll, before the die is rolled. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
... 'cause it's your skin to loose.

name: Loose Formation
effect: Permanent. Discard at any time, or when a new formation is played. Each Marine is +1 defense in Ranged Combat but -1 defense in Close Combat.
Don't bunch up, you'll make easy targets.

name: Loss of Command
effect: Permanent. Marine opponent whose last Leader has been killed has his hand size drop by 1.
Pull your team out, Gorman!

name: Lt Campbell
effect: Rotate to gain 1 Combat Pool.
He was the top of his class in tactics.

name: Lucky Break
effect: Play on a character you control when he is about to take damage. Choose an item to be destroyed instead. Character takes no damage. Discard item.
Now THAT was a good watch.

name: M240 Flame Thrower
effect: Plus 2 to hit. Does 7 damage. Plus 1 damage to an Alien card for each Alien token on it.
But it's a DRY heat.

name: M3 Body Armor
effect: Provides 2 armor.
Titanium alloy and ceramics provide essential protection for dangerous duty.

name: M41A Pulse Rifle
effect: Does 10 damage.
I'd like to introduce you to a personal friend of mine.

name: M42A Scope Rifle
effect: Does 13 damage. May atack two locations away at -2 to hit (-1 if Sniper). The rifle is rotated when fired, and the owner must rotate to ready it again.
Reach out and touch someone.

name: M56 Smart Gun
effect: Plus 1 to hit. Does 13 damage. Requires Smartgunner to use.
State of the art firepower.

name: Machine Shop
effect: Rotate a character at this location to repair 1 Damaged item he owns.
If you can break it, we can fix it.

name: Main Corridor
effect: The Main Corridor is adjacent to all other Central locations.
This corridor connects to all major sections of the base.

name: Makeshift Weapon
effect: When found, declare it to be any Weaponry item. It acts as that item, but with -1 to hit and -1 to damage.
Crude, but effective.

name: Malfunction
effect: Play on an item to damage it for this turn. If the item's owner is Unlucky, the effect is permanent. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
It works like this... err, it's supposed to work.

name: March of Time
effect: All effects with a duration decrease in duration by one turn immediately.
Though you may not note its passage...

name: Marine Private
effect: Multiple copies of this card may be selected as starting characters.
We just call him 'grunt.'

name: Marine Short Course
effect: Permanent. Add the Marine resource to one character you control at the same location as your Marine.
You started this. Show me everything. I can handle myself.

name: Marines, We Are Leaving
effect: Permanent. All of your characters are +1 speed, but must move to the Docking Bay by the shortest route, then evacuate.
Where's the sarge... we're outta here!

name: Mask
effect: Owner takes no damage from Environmental Gas.
For hostile atmospheres.

name: Masterful Shot
effect: Plus 1 to hit. In addition, plus 1 to hit if Veteran, plus 1 to hit if Marksman, and plus 1 to hit with a Scope Rifle. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Maybe one guy in a thousand could make this shot.

name: Mechanic
effect: Minus 1 to hit.
Half the stuff on base he's either made or had to fix.

name: Mechanic
effect: Minus 1 to hit.

Half the stuff on base he's either made or had to fix.

Promo card, the title is printed in a larger font than the font used during the production run.

name: Medical Assistance
effect: Rotate a human or Predator to heal one point of damage. In addition, heal one point if the character owns a Medikit, one point if you control a Medic that is at his location, and two points if at an Infirmary.
Battlefield medicine is a science all its own.

name: Medikit
effect: Rotate the owner to heal 2 damage from any human at the same location. Discard item.
It's good for more than just cuts and bruises.

name: Meditation
effect: Rotate a character you control to gain 1 Combat Pool (2 Combat Pool if Predator).
Mental readiness is the key to combat effectiveness.

name: Meeting Hall
effect: Public meetings are held here... but you've heard enough BS for one lifetime.

name: Melee Claws
effect: Does Power +3 damage.
They easily cut through flesh and bone.

name: Mess Hall
effect: How come everything 'tastes like chicken'?

name: Mk 35 Pressure Suit
effect: Provides 1 armor. Minus 1 to hit. Character takes no Environmental Damage.
Full body atmospheric protection, but bulky.

name: Mk 50 Compression Suit
effect: Charcter takes no Environmental Damage.
A high quality suit designed with combat in mind.

name: Motion Scanner
effect: Rotate item to view all hidden movement markers at this and all adjacent locations.
I've got movement! I've got signals!

name: Naginata
effect: Does Power +4 damage. Plus 1 defense in Close Combat.
Long and sharp enough to keep even the most dangerous prey at bay.

name: Natural Selection
effect: Unique. Permanent. Gain 1 Combat Pool for every character your Aliens capture or kill.
Survival of the fittest.

name: New Era in Science
effect: Your Marines learn how to use a Predator item you control at a cost in research equal to half the item's honor cost.
Too bad we can't build them as well as we use them.

name: Nobody's Home
effect: While an opponent is moving, all your characters at one location gain 2 moves immediately. You may not enter or leave an enemy's location.
Whatever happened, we missed it.

name: Not So Fast
effect: Cancel any Permanent Event card, or card with a duration of more than one turn. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
I may have something to say about that.

name: Nowhere to Hide
effect: Unique. Character must pay 2 Combat Pool (1 Combat Pool if a Predator) to use hidden movement this turn.
And nowhere to run...

name: Observe the Prey
effect: Each time your Predator or one of his hidden movement markers is attacked this turn, gain 1 Combat Pool.
He's stalking us... like a hunter.

name: On a Roll
effect: Character is allowed to roll again. Costs 2 Combat Pool or free if the character is lucky.
Press your advantages.

name: On the Move
effect: Your character is -2 to hit, but gains 3 moves to use at the end of combat.
Chew on that while I take a walk.

name: Oops
effect: Roll a second die when attacking. Add this roll -2 to your roll to hit.
Hope you saved enough shots to take him down.

name: Operations
effect:
This is the nerve center of the base.

This version of Operations came with the Aliens Starter Deck and the Marines Starter Deck.

name: Operations
effect:
This is the nerve center of the base.

This version of Operations came with the Aliens Starter Deck and the Predator Starter Deck.

name: Outcast
effect: Cannot win through Honor.
With no honor, he kills merely for pleasure.

name: Overconfidence
effect: Any 6 rolled to attack a Predator will hit this Combat round.
All I need to know is where they are.

name: Overkill
effect: Plus 1 damage. In addition, +1 damage if Predator, and +1 damage if more than one character is attacking your target.
Too little is never enough.

name: Overwatch
effect: Permanent. Character may rotate to attack during the Movement round (with +2 to hit if he has Tactics). Discard this card when the character moves or rotates.
Anything comes through that door, you drop it where it stands.

name: P-5000 Powerloader
effect: Owner may only enter Open locations. Owner's Power increases to 8, and all Close Combat attacks against him are at -2 to hit.
MOST people use it for heavy lifting.

name: Panic
effect: Move an uncontrolled Supporting Character into an adjacent location of your choice. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
In case of emergency, remain calm and proceed to the nearest exit.

name: Parker
effect: Rotate to find a Makeshift Weapon card from your deck. Shuffle your deck.
I think we ought to discuss the bonus situation.

name: Passed By
effect: Change the target of one Alien's attack to any other valid target.
We don't always understand their behavior.

name: Perfect Organism
effect: All injured Aliens at one location heal all damage if a kill is made there.
My mommy always said there were no monsters. No real ones. But there are.

name: Personal Data Locator
effect: Owner discards item to search his deck and find the first Supporting Character. Shuffle the deck.
Every colonist had one implanted.

name: Pet
effect: Pet does Power +1 damage. (Cannot pick up or use items.)
He's not as friendly as he looks.

name: Pet Hybrid
effect: If a pet is impregnated, replace the Chest Burster with this card instead of Alien Warrior. Pet Hybrid does Power +4 damage.
An Alien's shape is partially determined by its host's DNA.

name: Physician
effect: Minus 1 to hit. Rotate to heal 1 point of damage on a human character at the same location.
Take two aspirin. You know the rest.

name: Pincer Grab
effect: Plus 2 to hit. A hit does no damage, but the defender cannot move or rotate until the attacker leaves the location or rotates.
Don't ask what to do with it once you've got it.

name: Plasma Caster
effect: Does 15 damage. This weapon cannot run out of ammo.
The power of this energy weapon is beyond any human technology.

name: Pour It On
effect: Play on a character attacking Aliens. He gets free attacks, until he misses, at a cumulative -1 to hit. Pay 1 Combat Pool when making each attack.
Come and get it!

name: Power Outage
effect: Permanent. Characters may not move between Elevator cards. Locations no longer have Communications or Computers.
How could they do this? They're animals!

name: Power Plant
effect: You can't just throw another log on the fire.

name: Predator Hybrid
effect: If a Predator is impregnated, replace the Chest Burster with this card instead of an Alien Warrior. Hybrid may move 1 location during the Draw round. Hybrid does Power +3 damage.
The most dangerous hybrid yet known.

name: Predator Medikit
effect: Owner discards this item and rotates to heal 3 damage.
Predator medical technology is short on pain killers but highly effective.

name: Predator Mothership
effect: Predator at this location rotates to heal 2 points of damage. At this location, rotate to find any Predator item card in the player's deck for 1 honor.
The hunter's home away from homeworld.
attributes: • Restrictions: Only Entry locations may be adjacent.

name: Predator Ship
effect: Predator at this location rotates to heal 2 points of damage. Rotate at this location to search your deck and find the first Predator item card. Shuffle your deck.
It has an extensive trophy hall.
attributes: • Restrictions: Only Entry locations may be adjacent.

name: Predator Shuttle
effect: At this location, rotate to search your deck and find the first Predator item card. Shuffle your deck.
Small and cramped, it can just accommodate the hunters and their weapons.
attributes: • Restrictions: Only Entry locations may be adjacent.

name: Prepare Yourself
effect: Player immediately refills his hand to its current size. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Staying prepared means staying alive.

name: Primal Force
effect: Add 1 to either a character's Speed, Power, or rolls to hit for each 2 Combat Pool spent, to a maximum of 2. Lasts for the rest of the turn.
I'm ready man! I'm ready to get it on!

name: Programmer
effect: Minus 1 to hit. Rotate at a location with Computers to view a hidden movement marker at any connected location.
Coders virtually live in their own world.

name: Protect the Queen
effect: All Aliens at your Queen's location are +1 Speed and +1 Power this turn. May only be played once per player per turn.
Their metabolism speeds up when the Queen is threatened.

name: Pvt Hewitt
effect: Hewitt and Privates moving with him move with no penalty past all opponents.
Busted back to private for insubordination. Again.

name: Pvt Hudson
effect: Plus 1 to hit with Ranged weapons.
17 days? Hey, man... we're not going to last 17 hours!
attributes: • Resource: Marine, Lethal, Marksman, Coward, Unlucky, Veteran

name: Pvt Masters
effect: She's as tough as they come.

name: Pvt McIntyre
effect: I'm glad we brought him, we may NEED a medic!

name: Pvt Rogers
effect: He talks to his gun... and says that it answers. You wanna argue with him?

name: Pvt Von Gries
effect: A hard worker. Smart, too. That 'n five bucks still won't buy a cup of coffee.

name: Quarantine
effect: Humans rotate at this location to heal 1 damage. Costs 2 moves to enter or leave this location.
In a white room...

name: Quartermaster
effect: Unique.
He became the base's quartermaster after mustering out of the service.

name: Ransack
effect: Permanent. No items may be found at your character's current location. The location becomes Damaged. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
He's going to trash the place.
attributes: • Restrictions: Equipment, Military Arms, Weaponry, or Predator Item

name: Rapid Fire
effect: Each of your Marines makes one free attack. Costs 4 Combat Pool.
Hold the trigger down and don't let go.

name: Ravaged Chamber
effect: Play on a Damaged Breeding Chamber. It can no longer mature Aliens. This effect is permanent. If an Alien Queen is present, she takes 1 point of Environmental Damage. Costs 5 Combat Pool.
It's the only way to stop them from breeding.

name: Ready for Trouble
effect: Reveal one hidden movement marker at the same location as your character.
We're all strung out of shape. But stay frosty and alert.

name: Recon
effect: Begin using hidden movement with 2 markers.
Are any of your people in 'B' block?

name: Reflexive Action
effect: Plus 1 defense. In addition, +1 defense if Predator, and +1 defense if location if Open.
Train hard enough and it all becomes a matter of reflexes.

name: Regroup
effect: Unique. Remove this card from the game, along with all copies (in your deck, hand, or discards) of one other card of your choice. Shuffle your deck and discards without reducing your hand size.
OK people, let's try to avoid that mistake next time.

name: Remote Sensors
effect: You may view any hidden movement markers at one connected location.
Smile, you're on camera!

name: Rend
effect: Character does additional damage equal to the amount by which his roll to hit exceeded his target's defense.
Their claws will tear you apart.

name: Repair
effect: Repair a Damaged item. Owner must be in the Machine Shop, or at a location with a Mechanic.
You really ought to take better care of it next time.

name: Rescue
effect: Play when a character gets to the Breeding Chamber before one of his species is matured. Captive is free and undamaged.
I won't leave you behind. I promise.

name: Retreat
effect: Rotate any of your characters at a location with an enemy to move them to an adjacent location without one. Costs 1 Combat Pool per character.
I like to call it a strategic withdrawal.

name: Right to the Wall
effect: Roll 2 dice instead of 1 and take either roll. Costs 2 Combat Pool.
Great achievements surface under pressure.

name: Rip Asunder
effect: Queen who has hit her target applies her damage twice.
She's big. Really big.

name: Ripley
effect: Rotate at any time to move 1 location.
Well I don't care HOW, but we'd better think of something!

name: Rivalry
effect: Permanent. If none of your opponent's Marines is a leader, name any two. They may not end the movement round in the same location.
Why can't we all just get along?

name: Roll with It
effect: Plus 1 resistance. In addition, +1 resistance if Veteran, and +1 resistance if using armor.
INCOMING!

name: Royal Guard
effect: Must be created with Royal Jelly in the presence of a Queen. Rotate and discard to cancel one attack on its Queen. Royal Guard does Power +3 damage.
They guard her with their lives.

name: Royal Jelly
effect: Play when a Chest Burster matures. The new Alien becomes a Young Queen or Royal Guard instead of an Alien Warrior.
Mixed from saliva, the jelly chemically signals the developing organism.

name: Sacrifice
effect: Play immediately after an opponent kills one of your characters. You take Combat Pool from his pool equal to one-half the character's honor value.
You can't help them. You can't.

name: Saturation Fire
effect: After declaring an attack, additional Marines who can target the defender may rotate to help. The attacker gains +1 to hit for each helper (+2 if the helper has Tactics). The attacker runs out of ammo.
I capped off 200 rounds... nothing human could have survived.

name: Scattergun
effect: Plus 1 to hit. Does 10 damage. An Alien killed by a Scattergun does +1 Acid Splash damage.
Not unlike a high-tech shotgun. A traditional choice for Alien hunts.

name: Science Lab
effect: Characters who generate research points generate +1 research point at this location.
They're searching for Alien weaknesses.

name: Second Chance
effect: Take a card from your discard pile and add it to your hand. Costs 3 Combat Pool.
If it worked once, it may work again.

name: Secure Position
effect: Character may not be attacked by more than 2 opponents this Combat round.
Try to get past this.

name: Security Checkpoint
effect: Reveal any hidden markers at or moving through this location.
Motion sensors are standard equipment here.

name: Security Chief
effect: Unique. Rotate to make a Short-Ranged attack at +2 to hit, 8 damage or a Long-Ranged attack for 5 damage.
Nothing gets past him... unless you count the stuff that comes in on percentage.

name: Security Doors
effect: For the next 2 turns, all your opponents' move costs are doubled.
We can't count on the doors to hold them.

name: Security Guard
effect: Rotate to make a Short-Ranged attack for 7 damage.

Rent-A-Cops, even on the rim.

This version of Security Guard came with the Marines Starter Deck.

name: Security Guard
effect: Rotate to make a Short-Ranged attack for 7 damage.

Rent-A-Cops, even on the rim.

This version of Security Guard came with the Predator Starter Deck.

name: Security Station
effect: Plus 1 defense to all humans at this location.
This is the next best thing to a military base, without all the grunts.

name: Self Destruct
effect: Activate with Event card. Detonates at the end of 2 turns, destroying its location, all connected locations, and their contents. Discard cards.

name: Self Destruct Sequence
effect: Detonates at the end of 5 turns, destroying Operations, all connected locations, and their contents. Discard cards.
You now have five minutes to reach minimum safe distance.

name: Sensing Weakness
effect: Change the target of one of your Aliens at the start of Close Combat resolution. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
They're fast enough to change their target in the middle of a charge.

name: Sentry Gun Control
effect: Owner with an M42A Scope Rifle may rotate a UA 571C Sentry Gun during combat to make Sentry Gun attack a valid target within 2 locations of the owner.
I've got my finger on the button.

name: Settle the Score
effect: Defender uses only his base resistance. Cancels all other protection.
I'm gonna cut your name in 'im!

name: Sgt Bass
effect: Rotate to give all Marines at his location +1 to hit.
He says these drops are shaving time off his 'afterlife duty.'

name: Sgt Hart
effect: Plus 1 to hit. No cards using Combat Pool may be played on him or on anyone attacking him.
One round, one kill.

name: Sharp Eye
effect: 12 Honor. Plus 1 to hit with Ranged weapons.
Where he aims, he hits.

name: Short, Controlled Bursts
effect: Permanent. This character's weapons cannot run out of ammo.
A 3-round burst is optimum.

name: Shotgun
effect: Short-Ranged: +2 to hit and 8 damage. Long-Ranged: 5 damage. An Alien killed by a Shotgun does +2 Acid Splash Damage.
I keep this for close encounters.

name: Shotgun
effect: Short-Ranged: +2 to hit and 8 damage. Long-Ranged: 5 damage. An Alien killed by a Shotgun does +2 Acid Splash Damage.

I keep this for close encounters.

Promo card, the title is printed in a larger font than the font used during the production run.

name: Situational Awareness
effect: Examine another player's hand. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Pay attention and who knows, you may live through this.

name: Sleeper
effect: Minus 1 to hit. Has no speed for the first movement round after he is found. May be found at hive locations.
The joints take a while to warm up after some down time in cold sleep.

name: Slow Motion
effect: Any effects lasting more than 1 turn increase their duration by 1 turn immediately.
In times of stress, everything seems to go in slow motion.

name: Small Arms
effect: Does 7 Damage
Old-fashioned projectile weapons. Some things never go out of style.

name: Snapshot
effect: Play on a character during the Combat round. The character rotates immediately to attack at -1 to hit.
You don't always have time to aim. But you better make time to hit!

name: Somebody Wake Up Hicks
effect: Ready one Character. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
You're not gonna accomplish anything sleeping.

name: Sprint
effect: Play on one of your characters. His movement is doubled, but his defense drops to 0 for the rest of the turn.
Sometimes the best defense is a quick pair of legs.

name: Staff Worker
effect: Minus 1 to hit.
Don't ask me. I just work here.

name: Stairwell
effect: This location is distinct. It is not the same location as any other Stairwell. Characters may move between Stairwells for 2 moves.
Check those corners!

name: Stalking the Queen
effect: Over multiple turns, rotate 1 character at 3 different Hive locations. He may now travel to and from the Breeding Chamber and any Hive location for 2 moves. Effect is Permanent.
Once you pinpoint its location, you can get there quickly.

name: Standoff
effect: Any Alien attacks on characters you control at one location are canceled if those characters are not attacking.
There are very few things that will cause an Alien to pause.

name: Structural Damage
effect: Play after 20 points of Ranged damage missed their targets at one location in one Combat round. The location becomes Damaged.
I don't think the company's insurance policy will cover this.

name: Structural Repairs
effect: Rotate an Engineer, or any character you control with a Hand Welder, to repair his location.
A new paint job and she'll be as good as new.

name: Study the Enemy
effect: Place another Event card under a character you control. In his next combat, he must play that card (discard if it is not valid).
Every detail of the prey's behavior is cataloged.

name: Success Breeds Success
effect: Unique. Permanent. Gain one Combat Pool for each supporting character you rescue.
Fewer civilians to protect translates into better combat efficiency.

name: Superior Analysis
effect: Unique. For each attack this character observes this turn, at his or any adjacent location, add 1 Combat Pool to your Combat Pool.
The habits of the enemy are the key to his undoing.

name: Superior Species
effect: Each Alien token on card increases resistance by 1. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
... just one of those things was enough to wipe out my entire crew in less than 24 hours.

name: Sweep the Area
effect: Search your deck for the next location card. Play it adjacent to a location where you have a character. Move the character to the new location. Shuffle your deck.
... then establish a perimeter.

name: Tail Lash
effect: Your Alien gains one free attack. If it hits, no damage is applied, but defender loses 2 speed until the end of the next combat round.
As if claws and teeth weren't bad enough...

name: Tail Spear
effect: Queen does +3 Damage
Her tail is barbed and big enough to take down anything.

name: Take Aim
effect: After declaring an attack, you make no attack this turn, but are +3 to his the same target next turn.
The laser sight of a Predator can provide pinpoint accuracy.

name: Take Cover
effect: Plus 1 defense against Ranged attacks. In addition, +2 defense if character's location has Cover.
What they can't see they can't hit.

name: Take Him with You
effect: Play on a Marine who was just hit with enough damage to kill him. The Marine gets one free attack against his killer before the damage is applied.
I can even the score.

name: Take Names
effect: Gain 1 Combat Pool for each character or group your characters hit this turn. May only be played once per player per turn.
... and we're gonna kick some!

name: Take the Initiative
effect: Attack at +1 to hit. You do no damage, but every point you roll above your target's defense reduces his Combat Pool by 1 Combat Pool. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
He who hesitates is lost.

name: Takedown Strike
effect: Plus 1 to hit in Close Combat. In addition, +1 to hit in Close Combat if the attacker is Lethal.
Hit hard enough, and they WILL fall.

name: Tavern
effect: Rotate a Marine at this location at the beginning of the Movement round to draw one card.
All the comforts of home.

name: The Area Is Secure
effect: Play on a location with only your species present. No other players may move into or through the location until the next movement round.
Looks clear... for the moment.

name: The Hunt
effect: Choose a Marine or Queen. You gain double honor for killing it, but you cannot attack it unless its death would give you enough honor for victory. You may only play this card once per game.
They usually choose a worthy foe as their primary target on a hunt.

name: The Strong Survive
effect: All but one Alien card you control at each location ignores Environmental Damage this turn.
Evolution has afforded them many defenses.

name: The Will to Live
effect: Play on a character who has just been killed. He actually survives, 1 damage short of death. Costs 3 Combat Pool.
Put away your handkerchiefs, will ya?

name: There's Something in Here
effect: Play when an opponent enters one of your Hive locations. You immediately gain an Alien Warrior token on your Breeding Chamber.
They are everywhere in those hives.

name: This Changes Everything
effect: Player shuffles his hand into his deck and redraws a new hand. Costs 3 Combat Pool.
This is not a situation we had planned for.

name: Throwing Disk
effect: Total damage of: Power + 2 plus roll to hit minus defense. If attack is not a hit, the disk is dropped at that location.
So sharp, it can cut through just about anything it hits.

name: Tight Formation
effect: Permanent. Discard at any time or when a new formation is played. Each marine is +1 defense in Close Combat but -1 defense in Ranged Combat.
Keep close and cover each other!

name: Tighten the Perimeter
effect: Switch the position of two of your locations. Costs 1 Combat Pool per character at each location.
Don't give them too many avenues of attack.

name: Trick of the Light?
effect: Switch the location of 2 of your hidden markers for 2 Combat Pool, or for 4 Combat Pool if one of the markers is about to be revealed.
Everyone switch to infrared!

name: Trip
effect: Cancel an Event card that increases a character's defense. Must be played before the die is rolled. Costs 1 Combat Pool.
Watch out for loose wiring and cables.

name: Twice As Deadly
effect: Pay 3 Combat Pool (or 1 Combat Pool if Alien) to find more than one Supporting Character with one search activity.
They won't stop until we're all dead.

name: Twitchy Artificial Person
effect: Character may not move or rotate for the rest of the turn.
A few deaths were involved.

name: UA 571C Sentry Gun
effect: Rotate owner and drop item to activate. Plus 1 to hit. Does 13 damage. Gun makes a free attack at every non-human who enters its location.
This area is off limits. We mean it.

name: Under Its Gaze
effect: Supporting Character at a location with Aliens becomes uncontrolled for this turn.
Snakelike, they can immobilize a victim with their gaze.

name: Warrior Queen
effect: Can only be brought into play under special conditions. Warrior Queen does Power +3 Damage. (See special Alien rules.)
One ugly mother.

name: Water Processing
effect: Reveal any hidden Predator markers at or moving through this location. The Camouflage Suit is Damaged while at this location.
Might as well be a swimming pool, 'cept for the muck.

name: Weapon Cache
effect: Permanent. Adds Weaponry resource to a location, or Military Arms if Weaponry is already present.
Hey, hey, hey! Take a look at what I just found.

name: Weapons Locker
effect: Rotate at this location to search your deck and find the first Weaponry card. Shuffle your deck.
Some of my best friends sleep in here.

name: Welcome to the War
effect: Attacker rolls two dice instead of one and must use the lower roll. Costs 2 Combat Pool (or free if the attacker is unlucky).
Now get moving!

name: Where There's One
effect: A captured Supporting Character matures into 2 Chest Bursters instead of 1.
If you know of one, you can be sure there are others.

name: WO Kraver
effect: Rotate to search the top 3 cards of your deck. He finds any Supporting Characters. Discard other cards.
He runs all the platoon's trades and knows just about everybody.

name: You Want Some of This?
effect: Character makes one free Ranged attack against every character who has targeted him for Close Combat.
And you, you want some of this?

name: Young Queen
effect: Can only be brought into play under special conditions. Young Queen does Power +3 damage. (See special Alien rules.)
She will soon create a hive of her own.

name: Young Tusk
effect: 5 honor.
He is just gaining his reputation.

name: Young Tusk
effect: 5 honor.

He is just gaining his reputation.

Promo card, the title is printed in a larger font than the font used during the production run.
